titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, John Weber, Administrative Files, 1936-1956 UA.3.4.1A
titlestmt.author: Marianne Kasica.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:51:45 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, John Weber, Administrative Files
did.abstract: This collection contains the office files of the Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, John Weber, from 1936-1956.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred to the University Archives in 1968.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: All rights reserved. University of Pittsburgh.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by subject as it was in the Secretary's office. Some subjects, such as the construction projects, are subarranged. File 177 has been deleted.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, John Weber, Administrative Files, 1936-1956, UA.3.4.1A 1936-1956, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh, John Weber, Administrative Files, 1936-1956, UA.3.4.1A 1936-1956, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was originally inventoried by Archives staff and updated in 2012 by Marianne Kasica.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: John Weber was Secretary of the University of Pittsburgh from 1936-1956. These are the adminstrative files from his office arranged per the subject index provided by his office.

University of Pittsburgh -- Buildings -- Design and construction

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: During the Prohibition Era alcohol for medical, scientific and industrial purposes was strictly regulated but much needed by various laboratories, physicians and idustries. In order to allow the sale of alcohol an institution was required carefully track its dispensation. These reports document the quantities and departments that used alcohol during 1931-1932.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence about maintenance of director's residence.

scopecontent.p: Size and approximate cost of various projected rooms – music room, theater, library, etc. Layout of German room, 1928. Interior plans for Italian classroom. Blueprint of recreation rooms. See also FF 64.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Correspondence; invoices (donations of Carnegie Steel); blueprints; clipping of "topping out" of steel structure; information about corrosion; blueprints of fireproofing; "Practical Design of Wind Bracing" by Clyde T. Morris; specifications for structural steel work; steel prices as used in other office buildings; loads; correspondence concerning foundations; soil; transmittal of blueprints and drawings; modifications; memoranda of meetings, 1924-1927; steel estimate (1925); donation of 3, 000 tons of steel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Instructions to bidders; correspondence; proposals; orders; reports; costs; drawings. See also FF 9, 13.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

scopecontent.p: In re employment of Beam, C.H.; with universities – Chicago, Florida, Miami (equipment for chemistry labs, data on Miami freshmen), list of minimum equipment requirements for teaching biology – charts, slides, supplies, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Automatic temperature control. tests, graphs; Bellefield steam distributing system, correspondence, June 1934-June 1936; Construction, specifications: Edgar Station masonry work 5/1/1928; Walpole Ring Substation, 10/20/1926; Daily reports on heating systems, October 4, 1935-June 1, 1936.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Daily reports, continued; Degree day yearly data sheets, data; graphs, 1924-1934;

Burners, Articles concerning gas and oil burners: "Design and performance of domestic oil burners", Journal of the American Society of Heating and Ventilating Engineers: American Gas Association Monthly, June 1929; Natural Gas, July 1929; correspondence; coal consumption data, April-May 1929; memo on heat supply for university buildings, November 1928; heating system, costs, etc. for Carnegie Institute of Technology.

Temperature charts; automatic temperature control; graphs; thermostat settings at various buildings; Steam consumption by building, 1933-1935; Chemistry laboratories: temperature charts and graphs, May 1936.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Office hours; memos of Cathedral of Learning construction; insurance; ODK events; invitations; bills; miscellaneous; Organizations; his property; bills; son's compositions; university cafeteria profit and loss, 1928; ODK program 1929; ODK catalog and handbook, 1927; Torch Clubs – charter members list; Good Teaching, V.3 no. 9, V.3 no. 11; Klauder Christmas card; gas, water, alcohol, coal consumption charts for several buildings; personal post cards; tax receipts; "Franconia" cruise reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Equipment and correspondence about the production of films about Natural History; sale of said to Eastman Kodak.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Requirements; remodeling of some facilities; summary of reports of the department including numbers of students enrolled, teacher loads, recommendations, etc., 1922-1926; improvements to Trees Gym and Field; plans for tennis courts; water and gas consumption; official rules for diving, 1929

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Data relative to conversion of Carnegie Institute power plant into a central heating station; A study to determine the advisability of discontinuing the use of the Thaw Hall power plant1923; Specifications for lighting…1926; pamphlet of boiler tests of 1927; correspondence concerning heating fuel; concerning pumps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning compliance with Graphic Arts Code (National Recovery Administration); back wages due; printing orders; equipment; profit and loss statement 1929; balance sheet 1928-1929; letter concerning printing of Mammals of Pennsylvania by Samuel H. Williams; letters concerning print of bulletins, 1927; Graphic Arts Code; Bulletin about "Life at the University of Pittsburgh" 1928

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Numbers of Pharmacy graduates 1886-1923; chart of number of physicians supplied by University of Pittsburgh; chart of relation of instruction costs, salaries, etc., 1920-1923; correspondence concerning dentists in proportion to population, 1923; professional graduates practicing in Pittsburgh; memo concerning supply of college-trained workers; growth trends; survival percentages for entering students; numbers of physicians in Pennsylvania counties; population of Western Pennsylvania counties; dentists in Western Pennsylvania; engineering alumni in Western Pennsylvania; medical school graduates 1887-1923; teachers in Western Pennsylvania counties; attorneys in Pennsylvania counties; chart of Cleveland's occupational needs; teacher certification booklet, 1924

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Room assignments; registration schedules; bell times; course changes, January 1930; registration statistics 1930; scheduling of military science; admissions September 1929; grade registers; pre-registration statistics 1927-1929; University handbooks contents; distribution of credits, first semester, 1927-28; comparison of registration 1926 and 1927; statistics, 1925-35

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning rental property owned by the University; Correspondence with A.J. Kelly, Jr., of Commonwealth Real Estate Company concerning Cathedral of Learning, Stadium Road, various other properties

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning repair work, deposits for chemistry lockers, ROTC uniforms, complaints; buildings & grds work, 1926; room changes; remodeling; fire hazards. Also a reference to heating the drawing room in Frick Acres; resolution was to do nothing since the building was in the proposed Cathedral space.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Engineering education. Printed reports by Committee on Admissions and Eliminations. June 1925; National Industrial Conference Board, 1923; Address by A.A. Potter, June 1925.

Correspondence re subscription toward construction of Cathedral of Learning, 1925; Report summary – "Work of the University of Pittsburgh affecting the steel industry…"; contributions of the Medical School; report on extramural classes; "Summary of data showing relation of the University to U.S. "Researches of Mellon Institute of benefit to U.S. Steel;" population of Western Pennsylvania towns and numbers of students; "Memorandum of additional service…" – includes lists of students at Pitt from various U.S. Steel towns; teachers, physicians, dentists, pharmacists, USS office workers taking evening courses, former students employed by U.S. Steel.
